Detailed Description

Miscellaneous operations on frames.

Function Documentation

const char* cvl_check_version (  const char *  req_version  ) 
 

Parameters:
req_version The required version.
Check that the version of the library is at minimum the requested one and return the version string; return NULL if the condition is not satisfied. If a NULL is passed to this function, no check is done, but the version string is simply returned.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_diff (  const cvl_frame_t *  f1,
const cvl_frame_t *  f2
) 
 

Parameters:
f1 The first frame.
f2 The second frame.
Returns:
The differences between the frames.
Visualizes the differences between two frames. f1 and f2 must have the same dimensions and the same pixel type. The resulting frame will inherit these properties. The pixel values in the resulting frame will be the absolute of the difference of the corresponding pixels in the two sources. For RGB frames, the difference is computed separated by color channels: p1 = (r11, g12, b13), p2 = (r3, g11, b13) => (r8, g1, b0). For other pixel types, the luminosity difference is measured and represented by a gray value.

cvl_frame_t* cvl_frame_grid (  const cvl_frame_t *  frame,
double  factor,
int  w,
int  h
) 
 

Parameters:
frame A graylevel frame, interpreted as a depth map.
factor A factor (see below).
w The horirzontal grid distance in pixels.
h The vertical grid distance in pixels.
Returns:
The grid.
Visualizes depth maps as grids: computes a grid from the input frame, which must be a graylevel frame and is interpreted as a depth map. w and h are the horizontal and vertical grid distances in pixels. The minimum depth (gray value 255) will result in a vertical shift of factor * framewidth. The output frame will be this much higher than the input frame.
